pros: Very good atmosphere to work and advanced research is currently going on.
cons: Contract process takes a bit of time but if you start early it is manageable.

pros: there are not so much pros in this field!!!
cons: No independence, low salary, limited contract, no bonus, overloaded work

pros: Flexible hours Good working conditions
cons: Limited hours for contract Less pay

review_title: first to polish and then to profit
pros: freedom, freedom, freedom!!! you can get a degree certification while working here
cons: The salary is lower than in a company. You need to think about your next step after two or three years because of the end of the project. This makes people feel unsafe.

pros: The University of Stuttgart offers a lot of cooperation with industry allowing good networking and working on interesting practical problems.
cons: Challenging research environment, requiring independent work.

pros: Very nice colleagues and research topics
cons: No performance-based bonus, no performance reviews

pros: Organized, friendly environment, employee visa, cafeteria is good
cons: Language barrier (DE only, International center does not speak good english)

review_title: Terms and conditions of an MSc intern student at IBVT University of Stuttgart
pros: Hands on work from the very beginning, leading to large knowledge acquisition on diverse state of the arts and equipment. Good and comfy work enviroment. Flexible timetables. Access to very concrete literature and softwares.
cons: Hard working and competitive feeling. Lot of extra tiem invested.

pros: Research is accessible, flexible working hours, independent work, a great young team around you
cons: Extra hours are normal in research, and a lot of deadlines

pros: Located out of the city, close to nature. competitive Salary.
cons: there is no cons which really needs to be highlighted.

pros: Nice and innovative research environment
cons: it is a basic academic salary

pros: good public transportation. Good food
cons: there is not much to say about this

pros: good team and labs community
cons: work-life balance is not the best

pros: there is no pros for phd students.
cons: expensive rent rates. long working hours low salaries

pros: Everything is great and atmosphere well
cons: hardly to find one con

cons: time consuming - creating and correcting homework for students

pros: the Freedom you have as PhD student
cons: no money, half pay for full time, bullying professors, no support.

review_title: Great research environment, University can be difficult to navigate
pros: great interdisciplinary approach, well funded research projects at the state and federal level
cons: The university level administration is very difficult to navigate as an international employee

review_title: A vibrant and leading university in engineering  sciences
pros:
- Good connections to the industry (at least for most engineering majors).
- Has an active International center which also interacts with employee in addition to students.
- Great computational infrastructure
cons:
- Not much encouragement for teaching or becoming a lecturer 
- The common norm of having a part-time salary but having to work more (but it is varies from one institute to the other)

pros: Convenient place to work with supportive atmosphere. I received a lot of support from my employer at the institute
cons: Visa process in Stuttgart is a bit hard (complicated, but doable) and the job security in a university is not so good.

pros: flexible working hours, interesting, can work from home
cons: poor facilities, poor payment, lack of transparency, expected to work a part-time contract as if it is full time

pros: nice working time. great communication
cons: nothing to mention. fine salary

pros: Good working conditions, good payment
cons: Nothing was bad during my working time

pros: Great working space for people
cons: There are no cons in this place

pros: Flexible work hours, opportunity to work from home, academic environment and great atmosphere with Co workers.
cons: Low payment compared with the performed tasks. A lot of paper work and burocracy.

pros: Flexible work hour and challenging tasks
cons:
Lacking of guidance from supervisor/professors. 
Lacking of financial support from university.
No general goal, motive, and strategies from the management level of the university.
Not helpful for long-term career plan.

review_title: The working condition is pretty great
pros: Relaxing environment, flexible working hours
cons: The city is a little boring

pros: Very good organization and people are team-workers.
cons: I do not have anything "bad" to say about the University.

pros: A lot of companies in the neighborhood that are looking for graduated students
cons: Not too international, hard to be integrated if not German

job_title: Analog IC Design Engineer in Stuttgart
pros: good place to work full-time
cons: no comments at the moment

pros: I guess it comes down solely to your PhD supervisor, but in my case I was free to pursue my own interesting research with only little teaching obligations
cons: Some buildings are quite old and need renovation.

pros: decent income, flexible working time, all-round welfare
cons: the working environment is relatively conservative, less international

pros: Excellent Work Exposure. Possibility of free lancing
cons: Work contracts are always Limited with an expiry date, thereby making settlement uneasy.

pros: Good research facilities are available.
cons: very few international students present.

pros: constructive environment, good colleagues, good infrastructure
cons: limited contract, high pressure from peers, long working hours

pros: Helpful, international, seminars, contacts, conferences
cons: Far away, stressful sometimes, nomore

pros: They just pretend that they care about you and ask you "how can we help you", then, easily, to your face will say that no we won't.
cons: Nobody in the management cares about you when you face a problem, Nobody will give you a hand in your problems even though the people at the University are responsible for it. They do not accept their mistakes. They give you positive results in your face and negative at your back. Only think about their profit. There is no system to supervise professors. They behave unbelievably horrible. They do not listen to anyone. They do what ever they like to and don't fear anybody.

pros: - Good research, salaries go up every year or so, many different areas of research mean many opportunities are available. For students, it's possible to live 10 minutes away from work.
cons: Salaries not super high, some of the university institutes are far away from the main campus, having to deal with students is not always easy

review_title: Great team and environment to work in the Department of Sanitary Engineering and Water Recycling.
pros:
- Flexibility
- Organized, clean and quite work environment
- Lots of support
- Nice surroundings
- Close to the Stuttgart Campus
- Great place to learn
cons: Some people (10 %) would just speak German to you, which may be challenging if you are from an international program taught in English.

pros:
Challenging work
Flexible work schedules
Newest technology
Soft skills
Language skills improve
projects are well managed and a lot of money available from the Industry
programming experience
cons:
Low income
mostly still considered a student
no travel
work responsibility and challenge highly depends on supervisor
writing reports is sometimes too much critized since usually directly used for publications

review_title: Multinational and Multicultural Research Group on Solid Waste and Wastewater Management
pros: It is a multinational reseach with much experience in water and waste management. Most department staff are from different coutries across the world. Professors and reseachers are seasoned engineers and scientist
cons: Laboratory equipment should be updated

review_title: University of Stuttgart is a good employer with a fair salary while having the opportunity to graduate.
pros: Very good standing, good technical equipment (rooms, computers) and great opportunity to collaborate with scientists from various fields.
cons: The reimbursment process for business travels is a nightmare. It usually takes more than 2 months to get your money back.

review_title: Typical government funded research position leading to PhD degree
pros: Salary (government regulated) which is very good compared to PhD studentships funded by schlolarships, good working environment and technical infrastructure
cons: Not a lot of room for career development (employment limited to six years maximum, professorhips are extremely difficult to get and opportunities are very limited.

review_title: PhD position at the faculty of Architecture
pros: High level of freedom and responsibility in choosing the research direction. Great professional environment. Openness to collaborations within and outside of the University
cons: Overwhelming amount of teaching responsibilities and projects. No compensation for overtime. Often managerial responsibilities are outsourced to PhD students

review_title: Doing your PhD at the University of Stuttgart
pros: Good and safe city, green campus at the outskirts of the city, supermarket and mensa available
cons: It´s not among the top universities in Europe, so if you are looking for an excellent CV perhaps you should go elsewhere

pros: - A good university for robotics, architecture, engineering
cons:
- Stuttgart is one of the most (if not the most) expensive city in Germany as of 2019/2020
- Not particularly easy for non-German speaker to deal with paper works

review_title: Nice place to work, but human resources team is very rigid ¿.
pros: A lot to learn, many interesting projects.
cons: Human resources team makes the hiring process annoying and slow.

review_title: Obtaining a PhD is a good thing to do!
pros:
Best place to work!!! 
Much free time and good payment! PhD!?
cons: Little payment compared to industry
